characters: WE MOVE AROUND THRU THE EVENING
EXACTLY SEVEN DAYS BEFORE THE MURDER OF LAURA PALMER
AT THE DOORWAY OF LAURA'S BEDROOM
WE SEE COLE PUTTING HIS FINGERS IN FRONT OF HIS FACE AND
BACK IN THE CAR WITH LAURA
ON LIL PUTTING ONE HAND IN HER POCKET AND ONE IN A FIST
ON THE CLOCK IN HER ROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond and Stanley shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure.  I've heard a lot about  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM'S THE MAN WHO CRACKED THE WHITEMAN CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  I heard about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plowing ahead) YOUR SURPRISE, CHET.  HER NAME IS LIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIL walks to them from another room.  She goes into a con

dialogues.speaker: LIL'S DANCE
dialogues.text: Things we notice. --  She makes a sour face. --  She walks in place. --  She puts one hand in her pocket and makes a fist with --  While she is doing this, she blinks with both eyes. --  She is wearing a red wig. At one point during this Cole adds a sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE'S MY MOTHER'S SISTER'S GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole holds four fingers in front of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing the fingers) Federal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole gives him the thumbs up. Lil finishes her dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOOD LUCK, CHET. (turns to Sam) SAM, YOU STICK WITH CHET, HE'S GOT HIS OWN M.O. MODUS OPERANDI. (back to Chet) YOU CAN REACH ME AT THE PHILADELPHIA OFFICES.  I AM FLYING OUT TODAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Gordon.  We'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond's car on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they barrel down the highway -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was really something.  That dancing girl. (after a beat) What did it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code.  If you work with Gordon you learn that right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code, I've heard a lot about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond pulls his arm back so that only his fingers come sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of shorthand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (missing the humor) Shorthand.  really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're heading into a difficult situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain it to you.  Do you remember Lil's dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Desmond explains we -

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: In slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil was wearing a sour face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face had a sour look...  that means we're going to have trouble with the local authorities.  They are not going to be receptive to the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both eyes blinking means there is going to be trouble higher up...  the eyes of the local authority.  A sheriff and a deputy. That would be my guess.  Two of the local law enforcers are going to be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: ON LIL PUTTING ONE HAND IN HER POCKET AND ONE IN A FIST
dialogues.text: DESMOND (continued) If you noticed she had one hand in her pocket which means they are hiding something, and the other hand made a fist which means they are going to be belligerent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DESMOND (continued) Lil was walking in place which means there's going to be a lot of legwork involved.

dialogues.speaker: IS HIS SISTER'S GIRL.
dialogues.text: DESMOND (continued) Cole said Lil was "his mother's sister's girl".  What is missing in that sentence? The Uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the uncle is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Cole's Uncle but probably the sheriff's uncle in federal prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the sheriff had got an Uncle who's committed a serious crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, which is probably why Lil was wearing a red wig meaning we are headed into a dangerous situation.  Let me ask you something, Stanley, did you notice anything about the dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dress she was wearing had been altered to fit her.  I noticed a different colored thread where the dress had been taken in.  It wasn't her dress or she must have lost some weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon said you were good.  The tailored dress is our code for drugs.  Did you notice what was pinned to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, but I can't tell you about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rides along quietly for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Gordon's tie mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  That's just Gordon's bad taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't he have just told you all these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks loud.  And he loves his code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  He does talk loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon would not have sent us to Deer Meadow without thinking it was a  high priority situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be a high priority situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond's car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond and Stanley arrive.  The Sheriff's Station is in state outside...  They walk up to the old steps and enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Desmond and Stanley walk into a very small receptio the counter Desmond shows his badge to CLIFF HOWARD, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Federal Bureau of Investigation, Special Agent Chet Desmond.  I'd like to see Sheriff Cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff just smiles for a long minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you folks have a seat.  Make yourself at home.  It's gonna be a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond stays standing and Stanley sits.  After another l Cliff joins the SECRETARY in a conspiratorial giggle over wait they are planning to give the FBI.  In the middle of (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cliff smiles up at Desmond. CLIFF (continued) Why don't you have some of that coffee. It was fresh two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff has a good laugh over this and leans again over the pretending to look at some paper work.  They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's it.  I've had enough of the waiting room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still smiling) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond walks towards the door that obviously must go to Cable's office. Cliff blocks his way with his arm across the doorway, dar do something.  While they stare eye to eye, Desmond's han slowly towards Cliff's face in a slow mesmerizing way.  C to knock Chet's hand away.  Chet counters by grabbing Cli and pinches a nerve to its side injecting Cliff with a gr of pain. CLIFF (continued) AAAHHHHHHHH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond spins the deputy 180 degrees placing himself on t the office and then still pressing the nerve guides Cliff chair. While the Deputy's eyes tear copiously Desmond turns to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can start that FRESH pot of coffee right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond stalks to Sheriff Cable's office.  Stanley remain continuing to observe every detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF CABLE looks up from his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond shows his credentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation, Special Agent Chet Desmond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cliff, still holding his nose, appears just behind Desmon to him. DESMOND (continued) That's all right, Deputy, Sheriff Cable can take it from here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cable signals Cliff to leave. DESMOND (continued) I'm here to investigate the murder of Teresa Banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, little fella, we don't need any outside help here.  I don't like you people sniffin' around my neck of the woods.  In fact, when the state boys called me about a "J. Edgar" coming up I think I said, "So what?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your behavior is not funny and is wasting the time of the Federal Government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky I am not wasting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, little fella, let me put it this way. The operative word here would be "Federal".  With or without the semantics of all this, I am now ordering you to release all pertinent information concerning Teresa Banks, both while living and deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cable retrieves a box with the paper work and some person He throws it to Desmond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A basic kill.  Banks was a drifter and nobody knew her.  My boys have been all over this.  It's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we're here, Sheriff Cable. Where's the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back in our morgue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Desmond starts to leave. CABLE (continued) It's 4:30.  We close at five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got our own clock.  We'll lock up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Desmond turns to leave he notices on the wall a framed clipping with picture. The caption reads: "CABLE BENDS STEEL"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newspaper shows a picture of Cable in a He-Man pose b steel BAR into a U shape.  He turns to leave and Stanley have appeared right on time.  Desmond moves down the hall follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Desmond and Stanley walk to the adjoining morgue they steel BARS similar to the one they saw Cable bending in t

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MORGUE DOOR
dialogues.text: Stanley moves up to Desmond and speaks confidentially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Agent Desmond, I figure this whole office, furniture included, is worth 27,000 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond doesn't know what to say to him.  They enter the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teresa's body is on the platform in the middle of the roo hangs his recorder on the hooks at the end of the autopsy puts on rubber gloves.  Desmond opens Teresa Banks file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Teresa Banks lived at the Canyon Trailer Park for a month.  We'll check that.  And worked as a waitress at Hap's Truck Stop.  Worked the Night Shift. Good place for dinner when we're thru here, Sam. (flips to another page) No one came to claim the body and no known next of kin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Desmond is doing this, Stanley takes out his SPECIAL M Desmond looks up from his work and notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solved the Whiteman Case with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one could find those splinters without a machine like this.  And no one had a machine like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is good. (looks around) What do you think is in these other drawers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, later we could take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but let's finish up with this first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting to work, Stanley's face goes right over Teresa's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his recorder) Crushed skull.  Probable cause repeated blows to the back of the head with an obtuse angled blunt object.  Subject looks to be between 16 and 18 years of age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole said she was 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's eyes drift to Teresa's left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where her ring is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond notices the mark on her hand as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (looking into the personal effects) Personal effects include a watch, under garments, and a blue waitress uniform...  the ring is missing.  It says the rest of her things haven't been removed yet from the trailer.  Let's hope it's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley picks up her left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Stanley's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There appears to be a contusion under the ring finger of her left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley peers underneath the fingernail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laceration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley brings over his "Whiteman" instrument.  Works the under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accidental?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Desmond, would you hold the finger for me.  There's something up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets whatever it is with a long set of tweezers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a piece of paper with the letter "T" imprinted on it.  Take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond comes around and takes a look. INSERT: THE LETTER "T".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pondering what he has seen.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCENE
dialogues.text: We move across to a clock on the wall that reads:  5:04.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME CLOCK
dialogues.text: It now reads 3:33.  Stanley zips up a regulation body bag Teresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond and Stanley come out of the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, Agent Desmond, it's three-thirty in the morning.  Where are we going to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not.  You and I are going to get some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's been several hours since we've eaten.  I didn't realize that so much time had past, did you, Agent Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond takes a long look at Stanley. STANLEY (continued) You've got your own M.O., don't you, Agent Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond gets in and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond and Stanley talk with JACK, the manager who has b hair with a black full mustache to match, shiny silk shir strands sown in and an Indian turquoise belt.  He has a s shirt that says, "Say 'Goodbye' to JACK".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A GUY in the room is working on a light that keeps buzzin shorting out.  He doesn't really know what he's doing so poking at the wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had the FBI here once before.  Back in the fifties when Hap was running the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Hap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead - good and dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to ask you a few questions about Teresa Banks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Cable's already asked me a few questions about Teresa Banks.  She worked nights for a month.  That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see her with someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she ever mention any friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pointing) Ask Irene over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures thru a door that leads out to the diner, poin woman behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991
JACK (continued) Now, her name _is_ Irene and it _is_ night. Don't take it any further than that. There's nothin' good about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit at the counter and IRENE comes over to them.  Be the coffee and she is working on a cigarette.  Lipstick s the coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a good look around.  There's nobody in this place - you're meetin' the reason why.  What'll it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come Jack let's you work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and I are united in holy matrimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is casing the restaurant as Irene pours them a co of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing credentials) Federal Bureau of Investigation, Special Agent Chet Desmond.  I'd like to ask you a few questions about Teresa Banks. Jack said you knew her.  How well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She only worked here a month.  Nice girl.  Never seemed to get here on time though.  Ask me she had a little problem with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a sniff to indicate a "cocaine problem". IRENE (continued) Came looking for a job with a friend of hers.  Pretty girl.  Could've been her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only one job.  Teresa took the (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: IRENE (continued) job.  Her friend took a hike.  Never saw her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see Teresa take cocaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you take cocaine, Irene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I do not.  I never took cocaine or any other drugs.  I don't take drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicotine is a drug.  Caffeine is a drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Shorty?  Those drugs are legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with me. (back on the track) Anything you would like to tell us about Teresa Banks that would help us out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've thought about that.  I think her death is what you would call a "freak accident".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD GUY, long and skinny, smoking, gets Desmond's atte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talking about that little girl that was murdered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something to tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell shit from shinolah.  Gets me along way down that road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond moves away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we ought to question him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond looks down at the coffee cup in Stanley's _left_h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley checks his watch pouring hot coffee on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond guides his laugh into a cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch while his legs burn) Agent Desmond, it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself as be dabs his pants with napkins) It's not late, it's early.  Really early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene comes up to them with her purse in her hand.  She i duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I never told anybody, but once for about three days, just before her time, Teresa's arm went completely dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her left arm.  It was numb.  She said she couldn't use it.  Said it had no feeling. Probably from the drugs she was taking. (after a beat) I just thought I ought to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley watches her leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it was drugs, more likely a problem with a nerve.  I could recheck the arm for injuries, but for real nerve work we are going to have to take the body back to Portland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Desmond and Stanley head towards their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should see the sun rise at the Canyon Trailer Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you speaking to me in a code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sam, I'm speaking plainly and I mean just exactly what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, we should go to the Canyon Trailer Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene walks past them and towards the parking lot. STANLEY AND DESMOND Thanks, Irene.  Good... (catch themselves) Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god it is morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desmond and Stanley drive thru to the manager's trailer w surrounded by a small white picket fence.  They park and trailer.  Desmond knocks twice on the door.  From inside voice that makes Cole's voice sound like a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH, GOD, WHAT...  WHAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then Desmond and Stanley notice a sign on the door t "DO NOT EVER DISTURB BEFORE 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAN'T YOU READ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine's really late.  We are really early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both fumble for their badges as they hear the manage closer to the door.  They meet the manager, CARL RODD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn, this better be important.

dialogues.text: August 8, 1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc Hayward and Sheriff Truman watch the door of the bath anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop...  Coop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not getting any response Truman breaks open the door.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Cooper, in his pajamas, lies on the floor.  The mirror ab is shattered with blood all over it and the sink.  Cooper at them strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling strangely) I slipped and hit my head on the mirror. The glass broke as it struck my head. (laughs) It struck me as funny, Harry.  Do you understand me, Harry, it struck me as funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going right back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc and Truman help Cooper up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I haven't brushed my teeth yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper smiles at the uneasy pair.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK LODGE/RED ROOM
dialogues.text: Laura is sitting in a chair.  As the end credits begin... We move back to see that Laura is sitting in Cooper's lap same chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the main Fire Walk With Me page
